intro: Pluchea macdonnellensis, commonly known as the Macdonnell's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in rocky soils and open habitats. Its small yellow flowers are followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds, aiding in its propagation. It is often found in the Northern Territory and Queensland, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
